intro: Mentzelia laevicaulis var. laevicaulis, commonly known as the smoothleaf blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branching stems and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that attract various pollinators. It is a perennial plant that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments.
